thread.title: Other side of the cupcake: What playing LSU meant to Eastern Michigan
thread.title_full: Other side of the cupcake: What playing LSU meant to Eastern Michigan | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Other side of the cupcake: What playing LSU meant to Eastern Michigan
text:
With LSU charging up the board and into the College Football Playoff race, the Tigers schedule will be scrutinized. Sticking out like a sore thumb will be it's most obvious cupcake game, Eastern Michigan, currently 1-6.
While scheduling the Eagles is mostly talked about in terms of LSU's schedule difficulty, there's another side to that game, won by LSU 44-22. Eastern Michigan cleared nearly $840,000 for the the trip, according to the Eastern Echo .
LSU paid EMU $985,000 for the one-game contract and it works two ways. It gives LSU an opponent with a lower degree of difficulty while helping the coffers of a school trying to build a program. EMU spent $146,015.77 for the trip to Baton Rouge and came out $838,984.23 in the black.
